intro: Justicia sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered justicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, or yellow, which bloom in late summer to early fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. The flowers are attractive to hummingbirds and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to pollinator gardens.
